member.name: T:Xamarin.Contacts.Address
member.summary: Represents an address related to a .

member.name: C:Xamarin.Contacts.Address
member.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Address.City
member.summary: Gets or sets the city for this address.
member.value: The city of the address, or null if not set.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Address.Country
member.summary: Gets or sets the country of this address.
member.value: The country of the address, or null if not set.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Address.Label
member.summary: Gets or sets the label for this address.
member.value: The user's label for this address, or null if not set.

remarks.para: For address types built into the underlying OS, this contains a localized version of the label. If the type is custom, it will contain the custom label. In situations where types/labels are not supported, it will be null.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Address.PostalCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the postal code for this address.
member.value: The postal code of the address, or null if not set.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Address.Region
member.summary: Gets or sets the state/province/region for this address.
member.value: The state, province or region for this address or null if not set.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Address.StreetAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the street and house number for this address.
member.value: The street and house number for the address, or null if not set.

remarks.para: Some platforms multiple lines for the street address, or a non-mutually exclusive PO Box. If either of these are present, this property will contain all of the values, each separated by a new line.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Address.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of this address.
member.value: The type of address.

member.name: T:Xamarin.Contacts.AddressBook
member.summary: Represents the address book of the user.

remarks.para: For storing and retrieving contacts, use the most uniquely identifying information for a contact that is available, such as mobile phone numbers or personal email addresses. Even for platforms that provide , it is not neccessarily stable long term, as records can be removed and readded or merged.

example.para: This example shows how you can retrieve all contacts with the first name of "Eric" and has a phone listed. Then it iterates through the contacts, making a list of each person and their phones.

member.name: C:Xamarin.Contacts.AddressBook
member.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: C:Xamarin.Contacts.AddressBook(Android.Content.Context)
member.param: The to use to retrieve contacts.
member.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.AddressBook.AggregateContactsSupported
member.summary: Gets whether aggregated contacts are supported.
member.value: true if aggregated contacts are supported, false otherwise.

remarks.para: This will return true on Android and Windows Phone, false on iOS.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Contacts.AddressBook.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the .

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.AddressBook.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets whether this address book is read-only.
member.value: true if this address book is read-only, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Currently this will always return true.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Contacts.AddressBook.Load(System.String)
member.param: The of the contact to load.
member.summary: Attempts to load a contact for the specified .

remarks.para: If and are true, this will attempt to load the contact using as an aggregate ID. You can use to determine whether the is an aggregate ID or not when you originally obtained the contact.
On Android, with enabled, this can be used to retrieve instances from an Android contact lookup key.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.AddressBook.LoadSupported
member.summary: Gets whether is supported or not.
member.value: true on iOS and Android, false on Windows Phone.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.AddressBook.PreferContactAggregation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to prefer contact aggregation.
member.value: Whether or not to prefer contact aggregation, false by default.

remarks.para: Currently, only Android and Windows Phone support contact aggregation. As this may change in the future, you can use to determine whether this will actually enable contact aggregation or not.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Contacts.AddressBook.RequestPermission
member.summary: Requests permission to access the user's contacts.
member.returns: A task who's result will be true if given access to the user's contacts, false otherwise.

remarks.para: On iOS, calling this method is required before using the instance. For it's first call the user will be prompted for permission to access their contacts. On Android and Windows Phone, calling this method will check the manifest based permissions for contacts access on those platforms.
It's recommend that you call this method before accessing contacts regardless of platform.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.AddressBook.SingleContactsSupported
member.summary: Gets whether individual, non-aggregated contacts are supported.
member.value: true if non-aggregated contacts are supported, false otherwise.

remarks.para: This will return true on iOS and Android, false on Windows Phone.

member.name: T:Xamarin.Contacts.Contact
member.summary: Represents an individual or aggregate contact in the user's address book.

member.name: C:Xamarin.Contacts.Contact
member.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Contact.Addresses
member.summary: Gets or sets an enumeration of addresses belonging to this contact.
member.value: An enumeration of addresses, empty if there are no addresses.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Contact.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets or sets the display name for the contact.
member.value: The display name for the contact.

remarks.para: When retrieved from an address book, this is the OS-assembled name from the individual parts of the name, fit to display to the user.
Currently, setting this will manually not affect the other name properties, nor will setting them affect this value.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Contact.Emails
member.summary: Gets or sets an enumeration of email addresses belonging to this contact.
member.value: An enumeration of emails, empty if there are no emails.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Contact.FirstName
member.summary: Gets or sets the first (given) name of the contact.
member.value: The first or given name of the contact, or null if not set.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Contacts.Contact.GetThumbnail
member.summary: Gets a thumbnail of the Contact's photo.
member.returns: A thumbnail of the Contact's photo, null if there isn't one.
member.remarks: This is a on Android and a on iOS.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Contact.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for this contact.
member.value: The identifier for the contact on iOS and Android, null on Windows Phone.

remarks.para: It is not recommended to use this for storing references to contacts in long-term storage such as a file or database. Even for the platforms that support this property (iOS, Android), it is not neccessarily gauranteed to be stable long-term. Instead, use uniquely identifiable contact information such as a mobile phone number or personal email address.
Use to determine whether this is an aggregate identifier or not.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Contact.InstantMessagingAccounts
member.summary: Gets or sets an enumeration of instant messaging accounts belonging to this contact.
member.value: An enumeration of instant messaging accounts, empty if there are no accounts.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Contact.IsAggregate
member.summary: Gets whether this contact was retrieved with aggregation prefered and supported or not.
member.value: true if the contact was retrieved with and being true, false otherwise.

remarks.para: If true, it does not neccessarily mean that there are multiple contacts represented, but simply that it would if there were more than one contact. This allows you determine whether is an aggregate ID or a singular one.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Contact.LastName
member.summary: Gets or sets the last (family) name of the contact.
member.value: The last or family name of the contact, or null if not set.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Contact.MiddleName
member.summary: Gets or sets the middle name of the contact.
member.value: The middle name of the contact, or null if not set.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Contact.Nickname
member.summary: Gets or sets the nickname of the contact.
member.value: The nickname of the contact, or null if not set.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Contact.Notes
member.summary: Gets or sets an enumeration of notes for the contact.
member.value: An enumeration of notes for the contact, empty if there are no notes.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Contact.Organizations
member.summary: Gets or sets an enumeration of organizations the contact is a part of.
member.value: An enumeration of organizations the contact is a part of, empty if none.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Contact.Phones
member.summary: Gets or sets an enumeration of phones belonging to the contact.
member.value: An enumeration of phones belonging to the contact, empty if none.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Contact.Prefix
member.summary: Gets or sets the name prefix for the contact.
member.value: The name prefix for the contact, null if not set.

remarks.para: This contains name prefixes such as "Dr.", "Sir", etc.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Contacts.Contact.Relationships
member.summary: Gets or sets the relationships belonging to the contact.
member.value: An enumeration of relationships belonging to the contact, empty if none.

member.param: The complete file path to save the thumbnail to.
member.summary: Saves the contact's thumnail to a specified .

member.summary: Gets or sets the name suffix for the contact.
member.value: The name suffix for the contact, null if not set.

remarks.para: This contains name suffixes such as "Sr.", "Jr.", etc.

member.summary: Gets or sets an enumeration of websites for the contact.

member.name: T:Xamarin.Geolocation.Geolocator
member.summary: A class providing the ability to get or listen to the device's current geo-location.

member.name: C:Xamarin.Geolocation.Geolocator
member.param: The context from which to get the location service.
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new instance of the class (iOS only).

member.name: C:Xamarin.Geolocation.Geolocator(Android.Content.Context)
member.param: The context from which to get the location service.
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new instance of the class with a (Android only).

member.name: P:Xamarin.Geolocation.Geolocator.DesiredAccuracy
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired accuracy in meters.
member.value: Desired accuracy in meters.

remarks.para: This is only a hint to the underlying platform, you may receive location updates with higher or lower accuracy.
Changes to this while the geolocator will have no effect until the next time is called.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Geolocation.Geolocator.GetPositionAsync(System.Int32)
member.param: The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for before returning a best guess or cancelling.
member.summary: Requests the device's current location and returns a future to it.

remarks.para: The task will be set with the first with a greater than or equal to . If a position with the desired accuracy can not be obtained within , the most accurate position found will be used. If no position could be found at all within , the task will be canceled.

If the underlying platform needs to request location access permissions, it will be performed automatically. If all location services are disabled or a fatal error occurs, the future will contain with of . If the user has denied location access to the app (iOS), or the app didn't specify location acccess in its manifest (Android), the error will be .

member.name: M:Xamarin.Geolocation.Geolocator.GetPositionAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A to cancel the position request.
member.summary: Requests the device's current location and returns a future to it.

remarks.para: The task will be set with the first with a greater than or equal to .

If the underlying platform needs to request location access permissions, it will be performed automatically. If all location services are disabled or a fatal error occurs, the future will contain with of If the user has denied location access to the app (iOS), or the app didn't specify location acccess in its manifest (Android), the error will be .

member.name: M:Xamarin.Geolocation.Geolocator.GetPositionAsync(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.param: The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for before returning a best guess or cancelling.
Whether or not to also listen for heading changes.
member.summary: Requests the device's current location and returns a future to it.

remarks.para: The task will be set with the first with a greater than or equal to . If a position with the desired accuracy can not be obtained within , the most accurate position found will be used. If no position could be found at all within , the task will be canceled.

If the underlying platform needs to request location access permissions, it will be performed automatically. If all location services are disabled or a fatal error occurs, the future will contain with of GeolocationError.PositionUnavailable. If the user has denied location access to the app (iOS), or the app didn't specify location acccess in its manifest (Android), the error will be GelocationError.Unauthorized.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Geolocation.Geolocator.IsGeolocationAvailable
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether geolocation services are available on the device.
member.value: true if geolocation services are available; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Use this to determine whether the device supports geolocation. On Android, this will also be false if the manifest has not requested any location permissions.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Geolocation.Geolocator.IsGeolocationEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether geolocation is available and enabled.
member.value: true if geolocation is available and enabled; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Use this to determine whether geolocation is enabled by the user or not. It will also return false if geolocation is unavailable, so use it conjunction with if you wish to prompt the user about enabling geolocation services.

On iOS, this will be false if location services are disabled or explicitly turned off for this app. On Android, this will be false if both wifi and gps location services are disabled (and passive is unavailable).

member.name: P:Xamarin.Geolocation.Geolocator.IsListening
member.summary: Gets whether the position is currently being listened to.
member.value: true if this geolocator is currently listening to position updates; otherwise, false.

member.name: E:Xamarin.Geolocation.Geolocator.PositionChanged
member.summary: Raised when position information is updated.

remarks.para: This event will fire even when the contained is below .

The various implementations will do their best to provide the most accurate up to . In order to receive initial updates more quickly, you may receive less accurate updates to begin with. You may also begin receiving more accurate updates than you require, as is only a hint and can not definitively set what accuracy level you receive.

member.name: E:Xamarin.Geolocation.Geolocator.PositionError
member.summary: Raised when there is an error retrieving position information while listening.

remarks.para: Errors are raised only when listening (). If the app was suspended, there is no guarantee that this event will be raised upon resume if the user has disabled location services inbetween suspending and resuming. It's recommended that you stop listening on suspension and start again when the app is resumed.
If an error occurs, listening will be stopped automatically. Temporary errors will not be reported.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Geolocation.Geolocator.StartListening(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.param: A hint for the minimum time between position updates in milliseconds.
A hint for the minimum distance between position updates in meters.
member.summary: Starts listening to position changes with specified thresholds.

remarks.para: If the underlying OS needs to request location access permissions, it will occur automatically.
If a occurs, listening will be halted automatically.

The various implementations will do their best to provide the most accurate up to . In order to receive initial updates more quickly, you may receive less accurate updates to begin with. You may also begin receiving more accurate updates than you require, as is only a hint and can not definitively set what accuracy level you receive.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Geolocation.Geolocator.StartListening(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.param: A hint for the minimum time between position updates in milliseconds.
A hint for the minimum distance between position updates in meters.
Whether or not to also listen for heading.
member.summary: Starts listening to position changes with specified thresholds.

remarks.para: If the underlying OS needs to request location access permissions, it will occur automatically.
If a occurs, listening will be halted automatically.

The various implementations will do their best to provide the most accurate up to . In order to receive initial updates more quickly, you may receive less accurate updates to begin with. You may also begin receiving more accurate updates than you require, as is only a hint and can not definitively set what accuracy level you receive.

member.name: T:Xamarin.Media.MediaFile
member.summary: Represents a media file newly taken or picked from the gallery.

remarks.para: It's important to this when you're done with it to release any memory and temporary file resources being used for it.

On Windows Phone, file paths returned from the photo picker can not be easily reused. As such, they are copied locally under a "temp" directory in isolated storage for use with . Call to remove this file, but keep in mind that if your app crashes before you have a chance to dispose, this file will not be automatically reclaimed.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Media.MediaFile.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the .

member.name: M:Xamarin.Media.MediaFile.Finalize
member.summary: Deconstructs the MediaFile releasing all resources.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Media.MediaFile.GetStream
member.summary: Gets a stream to the media file.

remarks.para: Disposing the returned stream is separate from disposing the containing , ensure that you dispose both.
Where possible, this method will return a stream from memory instead of reading from storage.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Media.MediaFile.Path
member.summary: Gets the path to the file.
member.value: The path to the file.

remarks.para: On iOS and Android, this is the full path to the file. On Windows Phone, it's a relative path under isolated storage.

member.name: T:Xamarin.Media.MediaPicker
member.summary: Contains methods allowing the asynchronous picking and taking of media.

remarks.para: Only one async operation can be active at a time for a single instance of .

Avoid blocking on the resulting task (by using or ) from the pick and take operations. As these operations invoke the system UI for picking or taking media the operation occurs on the current UI thread and may deadlock the application. Instead, use to handle the result of the operation.

If the user cancels a pick or take operation, the returned task will continue with as true. If an error occured during the operation, will be true and will contain the errors. It's important to check for any exceptions as otherwise the exception will be rethrown when the task's finalizer runs.

On Windows Phone, your application may be deactivated while a pick or take operation UI is presented. To ensure that receives the result of the operation, the must be in class scope of your PhoneApplicationPage and it must be initialized in the page's constructor. This is an unavoidable limitation of the Windows Phone platform.

member.name: C:Xamarin.Media.MediaPicker
member.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: This constructor is available on iOS and Windows Phone.

member.name: C:Xamarin.Media.MediaPicker(Android.Content.Context)
member.param: The context to use for operations.
member.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: This constructor is only available on Android.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Media.MediaPicker.IsCameraAvailable
member.summary: Gets whether a camera is available on the device.
member.value: true if a camera is present and available, false otherwise.

remarks.para: Check this property before using or , as they will throw if it is false.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Media.MediaPicker.PhotosSupported
member.summary: Gets whether picking or taking photos is supported.
member.value: true if photos are supported, false otherwise.

remarks.para: Check this property before using or , as they will throw if it is false.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Media.MediaPicker.PickPhotoAsync
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous operation to pick a photo from the device's gallery by launching the system UI for this.

remarks.para: Avoid blocking on the resulting task (by using or ). As this operation invokes the system UI for picking a photo, the operation occurs on the current UI thread and may deadlock the application. Instead, use to handle the result of the operation.

If the user cancels the operation, the returned task will continue with as true. If an error occured during the operation, will be true and will contain the errors. It's important to check for any exceptions as otherwise the exception will be rethrown when the task's finalizer runs.
It's important to the returned when you're done with it to release any memory and temporary file resources being used for it.

On Windows Phone, file paths returned from the photo picker can not be easily reused. As such, they are copied locally under a "temp" directory in isolated storage for use with . Call to remove this file, but keep in mind that if your app crashes before you have a chance to dispose, this file will not be automatically reclaimed.

member.exception: Another async operation is pending on this

member.name: M:Xamarin.Media.MediaPicker.PickVideoAsync
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous operation to pick a video from the device's gallery by launching the system UI for this.

remarks.para: Avoid blocking on the resulting task (by using or ). As this operation invokes the system UI for picking a video, the operation occurs on the current UI thread and may deadlock the application. Instead, use to handle the result of the operation.

If the user cancels the operation, the returned task will continue with as true. If an error occured during the operation, will be true and will contain the errors. It's important to check for any exceptions as otherwise the exception will be rethrown when the task's finalizer runs.
It's important to the returned when you're done with it to release any memory and temporary file resources being used for it.

member.exception: Another async operation is pending on this

remarks.para: Avoid blocking on the resulting task (by using or ). As this operation invokes the system UI for taking photos, the operation occurs on the current UI thread and may deadlock the application. Instead, use to handle the result of the operation.

If the user cancels the operation, the returned task will continue with as true. If an error occured during the operation, will be true and will contain the errors. It's important to check for any exceptions as otherwise the exception will be rethrown when the task's finalizer runs.
It's important to the returned when you're done with it to release any memory and temporary file resources being used for it.

If the user cancels the operation, the returned task will continue with as true. If an error occured during the operation, will be true and will contain the errors. It's important to check for any exceptions as otherwise the exception will be rethrown when the task's finalizer runs.
It's important to the returned when you're done with it to release any memory and temporary file resources being used for it.

member.name: T:Xamarin.Media.StoreCameraMediaOptions
member.summary: Holds options for camera-based capturing operations.

member.name: C:Xamarin.Media.StoreCameraMediaOptions
member.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Media.StoreCameraMediaOptions.DefaultCamera
member.summary: Gets or sets the default camera to use for the operation.
member.value: The default camera to use for the operation.

remarks.para: This only serves as a hint to the host system to use the specified camera. If setting the default camera - or the camera selected - is unsupported, this property will be ignored.

member.name: T:Xamarin.Media.StoreMediaOptions
member.summary: Base class for media storing operations.

member.name: C:Xamarin.Media.StoreMediaOptions
member.summary: Constructs and intializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Media.StoreMediaOptions.Directory
member.summary: Gets or sets the directory to store the media in.
member.value: The directory to store the media in.

remarks.para: The media store operations have specific root folders they will store media in. This property acts as a sub-directory to those directories. If null, the operation will just use the root of it's specific directory.
On iOS and Windows Phone, the root directory is just the root of the application-specific storage area. On Android, the external storage folder most relevant to the operation will be used.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Media.StoreMediaOptions.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the file.
member.value: The name of the file to store the media as.

remarks.para: If this is null, the operation will generate a unique filename automatically. If a name without an extension is specified, an appropriate one will be added by the operation.

member.name: T:Xamarin.Media.StoreVideoOptions
member.summary: Holds options for storing videos.

member.summary: Gets or sets the desired length of the video recording.
member.value: A representing the desired elngth of the recording.

remarks.para: Not all camera implementations on Android respect this property, as such it should be considered only a hint and not a guarantee of result length.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Media.StoreVideoOptions.Quality
